column4: I have Ubuntu 11.10 installed on my laptop in dual boot mode. The grub comes, and I'm able to see the login screen as well. But I'm not able to sign in. Password and other details are correct. I can access all the files throught the virtual terminal. When I sign in, a black screen comes which does not even last for a second and then again the login screen comes.
Basically, I cannot access via GUI
What Desktop Env. do you use ?
try installing something else, (i.e gnome-shell) and see if something is wrong with Desktop Env. (the unity) or something else.
what exactly do I need to install?
one more problem...i'm not able to download packages via apt-get on the virtual terminal
Have you altereted anything at all ? or having the problem since Fresh install ?
this happened recently, after I had put a file in the startup applications
though. can you give more info about the problem ? have you got anything from Log files ?
i haven't modified any of the files
No, I mean have you tried to read and find out if there is any information logged about what is going wrong ?
i found how to delete the startup application using the terminal and deleted the file which I had put recently
fine, I'll do that and get back
